Q: To peel the shell off of a hard boiled egg.
O: (A) To begin peeling your eggs lightly tap the egg on some paper towel and crack the shell all over. Then with your thumb begin to peel the shell towards the egg. (B) To begin peeling your eggs lightly tap the egg on some paper towel and crack the shell all over. Then with your thumb begin to peel the shell away from the egg.

Question: To peel the shell off of a hard boiled egg.
Choices: (A) To begin peeling your eggs lightly tap the egg on some paper towel and crack the shell all over. Then with your thumb begin to peel the shell towards the egg. (B) To begin peeling your eggs lightly tap the egg on some paper towel and crack the shell all over. Then with your thumb begin to peel the shell away from the egg.

When peeling a hard boiled egg, it is important to crack the shell all over to make it easier to peel. By lightly tapping the egg on some paper towel, you can create small cracks all over the shell. Then, using your thumb, you can begin to peel the shell towards the egg. This method allows for a cleaner peel and reduces the risk of accidentally removing chunks of the egg white along with the shell. Peeling the shell away from the egg (option B) may result in a messier peel and a higher chance of damaging the egg.

This answer is more plausible because it is important to peel the shell away from the egg to avoid removing chunks of the egg white with the shell. Peeling the shell towards the egg can cause the egg white to stick to the shell and make it difficult to remove. Additionally, cracking the shell all over helps to loosen the shell from the egg, making it easier to peel.
